result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christopher Fowle in court.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for Christopher Fowle.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendnat was denied entrance to Drug Court. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Christopher Fowle in court.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for Christopher Fowle.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court advised defendant that they must be booked and printed at the Sheriff's Office. Discovery obtained, offer received. Asking for more time for negotiations. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved.

(6405) Defendant in court via phone. Attorney Mark Kershek appears. ADA Herrmann appears for the State of Wisconsin. Matter is on for f Preliminary Hearing today. Defendant have been advised of right to preliminary hearing and is waiving. Matter is bound over for trial. Not guilty pleas entered and trial reserved. Matter set over for STC w/ Judge Koss.
Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH AL SMITH SALOON. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Christopher Fowle in court.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for Christopher Fowle. Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Reading of complaint waived. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
